Package http.server

Class WebServer

java.lang.Object
http.server.WebServer
public class WebServer extends Object
A HTTP web server that response to basic HTTP requests. The code is based on : Example program from Chapter 1 Programming Spiders, Bots and Aggregators in Java Copyright 2001 by Jeff Heaton
Author:
Basma BELAHCEN, Ihssane YOUBI et Emma DRAPEAU

  • Constructor Details

    • WebServer

      public WebServer()

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start()
      WebServer constructor. Manages the treatment of HTTP request from different clients using sockets. Supported HTTP requests : GET, HEAD, POST, PUT, DELETE. Used port is 1234.
      See Also:
      getContentType(String), requestGET(String, String, PrintWriter, BufferedOutputStream), requestHEAD(String, String, PrintWriter), requestPOST(String, String, PrintWriter, BufferedOutputStream, BufferedInputStream), requestPUT(String, String, PrintWriter, BufferedOutputStream, BufferedInputStream), requestDELETE(String, String, PrintWriter), ServerSocket, Socket

    • getContentType

      public String getContentType​(String extension)
      Creates and returns the correct content type corresponding the extension file.
      Parameters:
      extension - The extension of the file
      Returns:
      ContentType to put in the HTTP response header

    • requestGET

      public void requestGET​(String filePath, String ressource, PrintWriter out, BufferedOutputStream outPutStream)
      Responses to a GET request. Sends the header and displays the content of the resource that is to get if it exists. Else returns and display error 404 Not Found message.
      Parameters:
      filePath - The path to the resource to get
      ressource - The name of the resource to get
      out - The output stream of remote socket (as a PrintWriter)
      outPutStream - The output stream of remote socket (as a BufferedOutputStream)

    • requestPOST

      public void requestPOST​(String filePath, String ressource, PrintWriter out, BufferedOutputStream outPutStream, BufferedInputStream inputStream)
      Responses to a POST request. Sends the header and updates the content of the resource if it exists. Else creates it.
      Parameters:
      filePath - The path to the resource
      ressource - The name of the resource to deal with
      out - The output stream of remote socket (as a PrintWriter)
      outPutStream - The output stream of remote socket (as a BufferedOutputStream)
      inputStream - The input stream of remote socket (as a BufferedOutputStream)

    • requestPUT

      public void requestPUT​(String filePath, String ressource, PrintWriter out, BufferedOutputStream outputStream, BufferedInputStream inputStream)
      Responses to a PUT request. Sends the header and empty the content of the resource if it exists. Else creates it empty.
      Parameters:
      filePath - The path to the resource
      ressource - The name of the resource to deal with
      out - The output stream of remote socket (as a PrintWriter)
      outputStream - The output stream of remote socket (as a BufferedOutputStream)
      inputStream - The input stream of remote socket (as a BufferedOutputStream)

    • requestHEAD

      public void requestHEAD​(String filePath, String ressource, PrintWriter out)
      Responses to a HEAD request. Sends the header corresponding to the resource if it exists. Else returns an error 404 Not Found header.
      Parameters:
      filePath - The path to the resource to get
      ressource - The name of the resource to get
      out - The output stream of remote socket (as a PrintWriter)

    • requestDELETE

      public void requestDELETE​(String filePath, String ressource, PrintWriter out)
      Responses to a DELETE request. Deletes the resource if it exists and if the access rights allow it. If the resource can't be deleted, returns an error 403 Forbidden. Else returns an error 404 Not Found header if the resource doesn't exist.
      Parameters:
      filePath - The path to the resource to get
      ressource - The name of the resource to get
      out - The output stream of remote socket (as a PrintWriter)

    • main

      public static void main​(String[] args)
      Start the application.
      Parameters:
      args - Command line parameters are not used.
